caption: Simple and beautiful church in front parc. The atmosphere here is calm and peaceful. I discovered this place while on a photography event.
Simple parish church from early 20th c with great organ, beautiful marble statues, and mosaic behind altar and in chapel.
Great church
Very friendly

We called for information and the person on the phone was anything but welcoming, far from Catholic behavior eh! It’s pitiful and embarrassing! This world is going very badly, even if the reception at the parish is deplorable, but my God! And so I'm not even talking to you about the lady who did the 2024 flea market, she is so aggressive, no kindness or sympathy! A bitter person, unsmiling and really very aggressive!
Pretty neighborhood church. The stained glass windows are worth a detour. The atmosphere is peaceful and the mini chapel which overlooks the street is original.
A church that is not magnificent but strange. From rue du Docteur Roux, it is accessed by a staircase; it is vast and clear and houses beautiful mosaics.

Today a so-called “charity” parish sale was held. But charity is only in name. This free-for-all seems mainly aimed at professionals and not at people from the parish and the neighborhood. Attention  ! You must receive a ticket to have access to the stands, but the ticket is only given at the beginning, so if you come after the opening, because you are working, and because you are not a professional, do not count not have access to the stands! Especially if you're from the neighborhood. In addition, second-hand dealers pass tickets on to each other, preventing access to individuals.  And this with complete impunity, without volunteers intervening, through complacency, duplicity and complicity. In fact the entire system put in place - very opaque - seems intended to give priority access to second-hand dealers - and we perceive certain connivance of the people who make up this little world on both sides, to the detriment of others, including the faithful. of the parish that we hear complaining about the situation, undoubtedly because these professionals pay for their purchases in cash... With complete discretion. Business is business.  The very hidden nature of this money deserves serious control by the public authorities (there is no trace of the transaction as soon as you pay in cash...). Only profit counts - but for whose benefit? Where is this money going? To whom? If at least it served to compensate the victims of attacks perpetrated by priests and recognized by Catholic authorities. Transparency and truth are essential. Furthermore, the people who oversee this sale are mostly odious and contemptuous, the absolute opposite of a Christian attitude.  They follow others in their tracks just to deceive, out of hypocrisy, to give themselves legitimacy because they know them to be honest, therefore without risk... On the other hand and conversely, they let others steal in front of them. them, shamelessly, in flagrante delicto but letting them do it! For fear of reprisals? By tacit complicity? In any case, this experience was an absolute disappointment but obviously the atmosphere perceived here corresponds to the other comments posted online.  Everything this morning was just bad spirits and a bad atmosphere. A complete lack of education. A real hell. Finally, if you don't come when it opens on the first day, there's no point in coming later, there will be nothing left. The second-hand dealers snatched up everything for their business and that of the parish. Going there after the first morning is therefore just a waste of time. Frankly, there are much better places in the neighborhood.

Very beautiful building from an architectural point of view. Very beautiful place of worship and prayer with its little corner dedicated to Our Lady of Passersby. I will come back to it as many times as possible.
thanks for the sound of the bells. Enjoy your last privileges
A very beautiful Church in the heart of Paris XV. To see and visit.

HOLINESS FOR SALE $€$€$€$€$ I would like to share here that this institution, which deceptively passes for a church, is nothing more than a grasping and greedy exclusive social club for upper-middle-class Catholics of the 15th century. I sent a very sick and destitute homeless woman to this church to request a mass. She requested a free or low-cost mass as she prayed to God regarding her illness and homelessness. And the people of this church refused it!!! These cruel people refused it because they are nothing more than a country club that is only interested in accumulating money and power to protect themselves and themselves. to advance their exclusive social lives and to ensure the conservative, exclusive and privileged education of their privileged children. One of the virtues of Catholicism is said to be non-attachment to material wealth. Jesus was poor, and all of his TRUE disciples were always poor and not power-crazed or money-hungry. It is disgusting that the secretary of this church refused to allow a service to a poor, sick, homeless woman because she had no money. Saying a Holy Mass is a sacramental ritual. This means that holiness is now FOR SALE. And the poor and homeless who are most desperate are not rich enough to afford the holiness of our miserable and debased days. If a church won't help a homeless person, then why should that church exist? It is certainly not a holy place. Just a shame. Revolting.

Small neighborhood parish, frequented by local residents. Almost permanent reception all day at the entrance. Has a lot of charm with its well-designed surface and the arrangement of the collection points.
Nice neighborhood church :)
A church that I love, since it is there that I did my confirmation in 2006. I also did a military ceremony with my former section of the French Navy (NPH). A simple church good for contemplation.

Jean Baptiste de La Salle (1651-1719). Founder of the institute "Frères des Écoles Chrétiennes" was canonized in 1900. Patron saint of teachers and educators. Its annual festival is scheduled on April 7th and is venerated by the Roman Catholic Church.
Stunning

I discovered this church by chance and since then I have attended mass every evening. I love the priests of this church. They are magnificent. I enjoy their sermons of such quality and great spirituality.
Very beautiful church with magnificent stained glass windows

A Church which is worth the detour for the family atmosphere and very collected at the 11 a.m. mass. Father Alexis, who has just taken office (March 9), is an elder of the Church of Saint-Germain-des-Prés. His homilies are very useful and touching.
Magnificent church like all the dwellings of the Lord. The stained glass windows are superb. Waaaouuu jado☀️♥️💛💚long live the Lord....Eternal is his Love …
Everyone follows the health regulations carefully I am always captivated by the calm and wisdom of the little children, at least those at the front!
My son died in May 2020. We were so well received. So much kindness.
It's good but as I went there for a bereavement it was moderately cheerful.
We discovered this church by chance, it is very pretty.
Wonderful church in the heart of Paris. Nice assembly of faithful 🙂 …
Friendship Days: sympathy, kindness, joyful and fraternal atmosphere Unbeatable sale!!!
Beautiful building which exudes calm, tranquility and contemplation
Touching sermons delivered by a great team of priests in the beautiful light of this church in the center of Paris
Beautiful church highlighted on top of a hill with perspective
This is a place of worship and also a school so how to rate but for me atheist very nice place
Very beautiful place Superb organ Great listening pleasure
A lively, young and dynamic parish. Lots of activities for everyone.
Beautiful church. I really enjoyed the coworking space.
Very beautiful church. Young and dynamic parish.
Beautiful, it seems to be very big like the other churches.
Completely renovated church. Quite cheerful. I recommend
